 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָחַף‎</span>] **verb** ==prostrate== (Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סחף‎</span>, Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סְחַף‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (for <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἐδαφίζω</span>, [[Luke.19.42|Luke 19:42]]); Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***sa—âpu***</u></abbr>, ***throw down, overwhelm***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָטָר סֹחֵף‎</span> [[Prov.28.3|Prov 28:3]] ***a prostrating rain*** (beating down grain), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאֵין‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָ֑חֶם‎</span> ***and*** (so) ***there is no bread***. **Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִסְחַף אַבִּירֶיךָ‎</span> [[Jer.46.15|Jer 46:15]] ***why are thy mighty ones*** (or, ***why is thy bull***, i.e. Apis, [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Gf|Gf]]) ***prostrated?*** but read perhaps <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָס חָף אַבִּירְךָ לאֹ עָמַד‎</span> ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#JDMich|Mich]] [[BDB#Gie|Gie]] [[BDB#Co|Co]]) ***why hath Apis fled, thy bull doth not stand?*** 



 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָחַר‎</span>] **verb** ==go around, about, travel about in== (Late Hebrew ***id., go about as merchant, pedlar***, perhaps denominative from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוֺחֵר‎</span> ([[BDB#Jastr|Jastr]]); **\*\***<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְחַר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵסְחַר‎</span> ***go about***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְחוֺר‎</span> = Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבִיב‎</span>. Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***go about as beggar, be beggar*** [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>2593</sup> (rate), especially Christian-Palestinian Aramaic see [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>Idioticon 61f.</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***sa—âru***</u></abbr>, ***turn, surround***, Tel Amarna ***return*** [[BDB#Wkl|Wkl]]<sup>TA Glossary</sup>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] ***surround*** (often), and derivatives; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***mock at, deride***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָֽחֲרוּ‎</span> [[Jer.14.18|Jer 14:18]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִסְחֲרוּ‎</span> [[Gen.34.21|Gen 34:21]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּסְחָ֑רוּ‎</span> [[Gen.42.34|Gen 42:34]] ***Imperative*** masculine plural suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְחָרוּהָ‎</span> [[Gen.34.10|Gen 34:10]] ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֵר‎</span> [[Gen.23.16|Gen 23:16]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוֺחֵר‎</span> [[Prov.31.14|Prov 31:14]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֵר‎</span> [[Isa.23.2|Isa 23:2]] feminine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחַרְתֵךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.27.12|Ezek 27:12]]; [[Ezek.27.16|Ezek 27:16]]; [[Ezek.27.18|Ezek 27:18]] + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֲרֹתַיִךְ‎</span> v[[Ezek.27.15|Ezek 27:15]] (see below); masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֲרִים‎</span> [[Gen.37.28|Gen 37:28]] + 2 t.; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֲרֵי‎</span> [[1Kgs.10.28|1Kgs 10:28]] + 3 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֲרַיִךְ‎</span> [[Isa.47.15|Isa 47:15]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָ֑יִךְ‎</span>- [[Ezek.27.21|Ezek 27:21]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רֶיהַ‎</span>- [[Isa.23.8|Isa 23:8]] — 

**1.** ***go about, to and fro*** (i.e. go about one's affairs, carry on one's business) ***in***, with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶרֶץ‎</span> [[Gen.42.34|Gen 42:34]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Gen.34.10|Gen 34:10]]; [[Gen.34.21|Gen 34:21]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלאֶֿרֶץ‎</span> [[Jer.14.18|Jer 14:18]], but dubious, [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Gf|Gf]] [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] Or [[BDB#Co|Co]]<sup>Hpt</sup> [[BDB#Rothst|Rothst]]<sup>Kau</sup> ***journey unto a land which*** they have not known. 

**2.** ***Participle*** = substantive ***a trafficker, trader*** (who ***goes about*** with wares, etc.) [[Gen.23.16|Gen 23:16]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), [[Gen.37.28|Gen 37:28]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Isa.23.2|Isa 23:2]]; [[Isa.23.8|Isa 23:8]]; [[Isa.47.15|Isa 47:15]]; [[1Kgs.10.28|1Kgs 10:28]] = [[2Chr.1.16|2Chr 1:16]]; [[Ezek.27.21|Ezek 27:21]] (twice in verse); [[Ezek.27.36|Ezek 27:36]]; [[Ezek.38.13|Ezek 38:13]] + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּרִים‎</span> [[2Chr.9.14|2Chr 9:14]] feminine, of a city or country, [[Ezek.27.12|Ezek 27:12]]; [[Ezek.27.16|Ezek 27:16]]; [[Ezek.27.18|Ezek 27:18]] also in v[[Ezek.27.15|Ezek 27:15]] read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹחֲרֹתַיִךְ‎</span> for [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ידך‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְחֹרַת‎</span> [[BDB#Sm|Sm]] [[BDB#Co|Co]] [[BDB#Berthol|Berthol]] Toy. **Pilpel** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִבִּי סְחַרְחַר‎</span> [[Ps.38.11|Ps 38:11]] ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:55e»§ 55e</sup>) ***my heart palpittes*** (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲזָבַנִי כֹחִי‎</span>).
